title: 105_hr141
content: The "Section Commission to Advise on Reforming Elections Act" establishes a Select Commission to study campaign finance laws for Federal elections and recommend reforms. The Commission, composed of 12 members appointed by the President, will include nominees from majority and minority leaders of the House and Senate, as well as individuals chosen by the President. The Commission will select two members to serve as Chair. The Commission, consisting of 12 members appointed by the President, will have two co-chairs selected by the members. Members will serve for the duration of the Commission, and vacancies will be filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Commission, with 12 members appointed by the President, has the power to hold hearings, take testimony, and receive evidence as needed. Five members constitute a quorum for hearings. Administrative provisions are outlined in Section 5. The Commission members are paid based on their level, with co-chairs receiving a higher rate. They also receive travel expenses as per regulations. Additionally, a staff director will be appointed by the Commission. The Commission appoints a staff director who will be paid at the rate of basic pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule. The staff director can appoint necessary personnel without following certain regulations on appointments and pay rates. The staff director of the Commission may procure temporary and intermittent services with approval, following regulations on pay rates. SEC. 6. REPORT AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CHANGES IN LAW. The Commission must submit a report of its activities to key government officials within 180 days of its members' appointment. Additionally, the Commission is required to propose any recommendations for changes in campaign finance laws that seven or more members agree upon. The Commission must include any dissenting views and minority recommendations in the report submitted within 180 days of its appointment. Any additional recommendations must be submitted in a supplemental report with majority approval, no later than 180 days after the initial report. The final deadline for submitting recommendations is July 15, 1998. SEC. 7. EXPEDITED CONGRESSIONAL CONSIDERATION OF LEGISLATION IMPLEMENTING RECOMMENDATIONS. If the Commission recommends changes in laws, members must include legislation to implement the recommendation. Legislation implementing Commission recommendations will receive expedited congressional consideration. The rules regarding references to committees and dates for report transmittal are clarified in relation to the Commission's recommendations for legislative changes. The Commission will cease to exist 90 days after submitting its report or recommendations.
